Key Match Events: Xie Wenneng scored against the run of play in the first half
Lewis Miller scored a header in first-half stoppage time to equalize
Craig Goodwin scored a screamer in the second half
Nishan Velupillay scored a debut goal in stoppage time
Pre-Game Insights: The Socceroos made five changes from Graham Arnold's last side
Tony Popovic was making his first match as coach
The Socceroos were at risk of drifting out of contention for the top two qualification spots
Joe Gauci commented on the team's improved patience and trust in opportunities
Post-Match Reflections: Joe Gauci praised the team's character and response to the situation
Craig Goodwin expressed satisfaction with his goal and the team's performance
Tony Popovic emphasized the importance of the win and the upcoming challenge against Japan
Miscellaneous Highlights: Craig Goodwin's goal was described as 'exactly how I imagined it'
The match was held at Adelaide Oval with a crowd of 46,291 supporters
The Socceroos will face Japan in Saitama on Tuesday night
